channel.title: Latest Finextra Research Cards Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Financial IT Cards Headlines

item.title: Apple Pay launches UK open banking integration for Wallet
item.description: Apple Pay users across the UK can now take advantage of a new feature that taps into the open banking framework to let them connect cards and view their account balance from within the Wallet app.

item.title: Lynx raises $18m for AI-powered fraud fighting tech
item.description: Lynx, a Madrid-based firm using AI to detect and prevent fraud and financial crimes, has raised $!8 million in Seres A funding.

item.title: Co-branded card provider Imprint bags $75 million funding round
item.description: Co-branded credit card provider Imprint has raised $75 million in Series B funding.

item.title: Goldman Sachs bids to offload GM credit card
item.description: Goldman Sachs is preparing to sell off its General Motors credit card programme as part of its wider retreat from the retail market, according to the Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Fed confirms plan to slash debit card fees
item.description: The Federal Reserve has proposed lowering the debit interchange fees banks can charge merchants by nearly 30% and reviewing the cap every two years.

item.title: Curve issues first credit card
item.description: All-in-one card app Curve has launched its first ever credit card in the UK, providing users with protection against problem purchases even when using a debit card.

item.title: Citi alleviates corporate spend management in partnership with Navan
item.description: Citi is rolling out a new travel and expense management system for its US corporate clients in an attempt to fend off competition from a wave of cherry-picking fintech startups.

item.title: Fiserv opens the door to embedded finance
item.description: Fiserv is making a move into embedded finance, making capabilities from its merchant acceptance, banking, and card issuing businesses available to others through a set of APIs.

item.title: Fed expected to lower debit card fee cap
item.description: The Federal Reserve is expected to propose lowering the debit interchange fees banks can charge merchants.

item.title: Marqeta inks deal with European BNPL firm Scalapay
item.description: Marqeta has reached an agreement with Southern European BNPL provider Scalapay to use its platform to issue cards both online and in-store.

item.title: Axis Bank and Fibe team on India's first numberless credit card
item.description: India's Axis Bank has joined forced with local fintech Fibe to launch the country's first numberless credit card.

item.title: POS startup Lopay raises £6m
item.description: British app-based POS startup Lopay has raised £6 million in a seed funding round joined by BackedVC, Portage and The Venture Collective.

item.title: Green Dot appoints Dave Harden CTO
item.description: Green Dot Corporation (NYSE: GDOT) today announced the appointment of Dave Harden as Chief Technology Officer supporting the company’s ongoing effort to become a more streamlined, efficient and powerful technology company focused on building and delivering seamless and scalable banking and payment tools for consumers and businesses.

item.title: Fabrick and Banque Edel collaborate on gift card payments
item.description: Fabrick, a European pioneer in Open Finance, and Banque Edel (E.Leclerc) are excited to announce a  collaboration aimed at modernising the invoicing process of gift cards for its CSE customers.

item.title: Bling releases payment card built for parents
item.description: Bling, Europe's first Family FinTech, is reinventing traditional retail banking for families. The launch of Family+ and Parent Card marks the transformation of Bling into a family finance platform for the whole family.

item.title: Enfuce and Funding Circle combine to issue new business credit card for small businesses
item.description: Enfuce, the leading provider of embedded finance solutions today announces a new partnership with the UK’s leading small business lending platform, Funding Circle, to launch its new small business credit card as part of its FlexiPay product.

item.title: Apple launches tap to Pay on iPhone in France
item.description: Apple has announced that businesses based in France can now accept in-person and contactless payments via Tap to Pay on iPhone.

item.title: Acorns and Dwayne Johnson launch Mighty Oak debit card
item.description: Dwayne Johnson and Acorns, a saving and investing app, have announced the launch of the Mighty Oak Debit Card. The heavy metal Tungsten debit card, exclusive to Acorns, was constructed to address a fundamental American problem: overspending and under-saving.

item.title: Qonto issues 100% recycled cards
item.description: Qonto, the leading European business finance solution, has partnered with IDEMIA, the global leader in identity technologies, to launch the new cards lineup made from 100% recycled plastic materials.

item.title: Worldline enables Tap to Pay on iPhone for large businesses in France
item.description: Worldline [Euronext: WLN], a global leader in payment services, announces it has enabled Tap to Pay on iPhone for large merchant customers in France.

item.title: Saudi Awwal Bank partners Mastercard
item.description: Saudi Awwal Bank (SAB) has partnered with Mastercard to offer consumers across the country greater access to secure digital transactions.

item.title: Nigeria enlists Visa and eGate for digital ID and payments push
item.description: The Nigerian government (Nasdra) signed a agreement with eGate and VISA, to enhance the country’s digital infrastructure and provide a citizens digital identity and unified payment cards.

item.title: Visa takes account update technology to Apac markets
item.description: Visa, a world leader in digital payments, today announced the expansion of Real Time Visa Account Updater (VAU) to selected markets in Asia Pacific, streamlining the payment experience for merchants and customers by providing cardholders with a single credential for life.

item.title: Jaja Finance breaks into the near-prime credit card space
item.description: Jaja Finance (“Jaja”) has opened up to applications from new customers to bring more competition and choice to the near-prime lending market, giving UK borrowers the chance to reclaim their purchasing power with the new Jaja Vanta Purchase Credit Card.

item.title: Payments in a hyper-personalized world
item.description: Randy Kern, Chief Technology Officer, Marqeta joins FinextraTV at Money20/20 in Las Vegas, discussing how the expectations of customers are shifting in a hyper-personalized world, what innovations are being made in APIs, and how the nature of card payments are changing to meet the demands for quick, efficient and seamless payments.

item.title: Fiat Currency 2.0: Counter argument to the Cryptocurrency narrative
item.description: Tony McLaughlin, Emerging Payments & Business Development, Citi, speaks at Money 20/20 USA about the practical problems that still need addressing in the crypto-currency community, how Fiat Currency 2.0 will help fix payments as a counter balance to crypto and what challenges still exist around tokenisation and coins. We ask how this impacts the big techs and what regulatory, political and ethical concerns need to be addressed first before they achieve their own currencies.

item.title: Developer Day at FusionONE stirs excitement among the users
item.description: Finextra’s Hannah Wallace reports on day two of the FusionONE open banking developer conference to learn more about Finastra’s vision for the future of banking re-engineered upon APIs and open platforms. We gain exclusive insight from the developers into what's exciting them most about FusionFabric.cloud and how they are looking to innovate and create using the platform.

item.title: Encapsulating themes from the payments market
item.description: Marion King, Director of Payments, NatWest, speaks about her role and the responsibility it entails, including determining payments strategy for a major UK Bank, keeping NatWest's customers secure, regulation and innovation, what key themes we are seeing in the payments market and the developments to come.

item.title: Exploring new commerce: Mastercard's Sonic Signature
item.description: Raja Rajamannar, Chief Marketing & Communications Officer and President, Healthcare Business, Mastercard, speaks at Mobile World Congress about the unveiling of Mastercard's Sonic Brand, the thinking behind the new musical logo and how it was developed.

item.title: The Power of Partnerships: Trust, Data & Digital Identity
item.description: Ann Cairns, Vice Chair, Mastercard, speaks at Mobile World Congress 2019 about the importance of partnerships, Mastercard's partnership with Microsoft, how they are using data in medicine and towards social reform, and what impact neobanks are having on the industry.

item.title: Industry challenges around IBOR Transition
item.description: Andrew Kouloumbrides, CEO, Xceptor and Bruce Laing, Partner, IBOR Transition lead, Baringa, speaks about the industry challenges around IBOR Transition, what Financial Institutions have done up to date to meet these challenges and what to expect next.

item.title: The global adoption of real-time payments, sparking industry innovation
item.description: Paul Stoddart, Chief Executive Officer, Vocalink & Colleen Taylor, Executive Vice President, Mastercard, speak at Sibos 2018 in Sydney about recent innovations having an impact on the consumer, which markets are ahead of the curve when it comes to adopting the latest real-time applications and how some of the latest innovations have tackled the issue of security, when leveraging the real-time rails.

item.title: When, if ever, will the Nordics become cashless?
item.description: Erik Zingmark, Head of Transaction Banking, Nordea, speaks at Sibos 2018 in Sydney, whether banks are really being disrupted by fintechs, what corporates are expecting from their banks in the next 3 to 5 years, and when, if ever, it will become cashless in the Nordics.

item.title: Bringing together the vision of connected commerce
item.description: Gerrard Schmid, President and Chief Executive Officer Diebold Nixdorf, speaks at Diebold Nixdorf's International Management Seminar in Lisbon, about how banks need to support their customers through multi-channels as a result of digitisation, what is driving mobile banking, where the potential is for retail banks, and whether cash is really becoming extinct.

item.title: The combined effect of Open Banking and Real-time Payments
item.description: Jerry Norton, Vice President and Global Head of Banking for CGI, talks about how the combined effect of Open Banking and real-time payments on banks and what they need to do to adapt to the changing landscape.

item.title: Digitalizing CLM for improved customer experience
item.description: Joe Dunphy, VP of Product Management, Fenergo, discusses what benefits digitalising the client lifecycle experience can bring financial institutions and their clients, how Fenergo’s CLM roadmap has evolved over the past two years to deliver greater transparency and control, and the importance of Fenergo’s global client community for driving industry best practice.

item.title: KYC, AML & Transparency for Crypto-Currencies & ICOs
item.description: Conor Coughlan, Global Head of Marketing, Fenergo, discusses the challenges facing institutions, issuers, exchanges, & investors in determining viability & suitability, for investing in crypto-currencies, ICOs and derived offerings so that this new asset class can mature, open up to institutional investors and play a more value adding role in the global economy.

item.description: A new age in the ever-changing world of modern finance is being ushered in by the use of technology ...
